I just happened to catch the hearing on baseball and Roger Clemens and the 'steroid' use. I'd like to hear opinions on this topic.
No problem.
 
 
With all that's going on in the world today, does baseball steroid use matter?
Yes. Competitive sports should not be tainted with performance enhancing drugs.
 
 

 Do you care?
To the extent that young people are being taught that it's okay to cheat and risk permanent body damage by using steroids, yes I care. Steroids should not be allowed in any sports, pro or amateur.
 
 

 Should Congress be using tax payers' money on this type of thing?
No. Congress should have nothing to do with sports except to bet on games.
 
 

 Does Baseball matter at all, ...
Yes.
 
 
 
...or is it the most boring sport ever that should have been abandoned with the invention of Television?
The attendance records at games across the country should tell you it's not the most boring sport ever. It's a great sport. It's just been tainted by people like Barry Bonds and others.
 
 I personally wouldn't give a dime for a DVD set of every game ever played, but it is exciting and lucrative to a lot of people. A shipload of money changes hands and helps the economy.
 
 I'm curious what the advent of television had to do with the need for baseball.
